data.title: Interview with Paula Cole
data.meta_description: There are about 5 female artists in my world that I refer to by first name.  Sarah (McLachlan), Shawn (Colvin), Patty (Griffin), Jonatha (Brooke) and PAULA.  My very first interview of all time just happens to be with on...
data.text:
“Kristin Cifelli’s voice is a practiced instrument; she is in full control while singing with thrilling emotion - striking, tender at one moment - then powerful, soaring, carrying us along to a musical and lyrical peak." (WCUW 91.3 FM, Worcester)

“…She’s got the voice, the talent and the originality while she breaks from the pack of local songwriters with the best of devices: realness.” (Northeast Performer).

"The music has a twangy dreaminess about it that would make Chris Isaak sit up and take notice." (indie-music.com).

“…I think there’s no justice if she doesn’t become really successful…” (Brad Delp of BOSTON);

...and simply, “Stunning” (Cape Cod Journal).

Boston Music Award Nominee, Kristin Cifelli has been on Berklee's Voice faculty since 2001, specializing in coaching singer/songwriters. She has toured the country, sharing the stage with artists such as Jeffrey Gaines, Chris Trapper, Marshall Crenshaw, and Rita Wilson. Kristin’s 2011 release, Middle of Nowhere, attracted the attention of folks from hipsters to hippies, with its earthy, yet modern sound. She is currently at work writing songs for a new release.
